title.narrative: Academic Entitlement Program for Yemeni Children (I have the right to learn)

description.narrative: 1. Complete the summer semester for children at risk of dropping out of school. 2. Apply the one-class schools model in the local communities where there are no formal educational schools. 3. Providing enrichment-based therapeutic support programs for children affected by conflict after times outside formal work. 4. Designing and developing scientific guides for male and female teachers. 5. Design and develop the curricula of the Yemeni Ministry of Education with a one-class schools model.

At least 25,000 children (at least 50% of girls) benefit from the second educational opportunity programs for out-of-school children and those at risk. The continuation of the educational process in local communities through 50 schools from the one-class schools model. Enabling enrichment therapy support programs in 50 schools.

The project aims to provide a second educational and entitlement opportunity for children who are not enrolled in school and at risk (ages 7 to 14 years), and provides intensive and expedited programs to support the inclusion of children who have been out of school for two years or more to return them to school education.
